nodes.bodyText: Do you test these properties? Is it possible property which is specified for all dbms to override property for specific dbms?

nodes.bodyText: Yup, I just tested it. Changing this line to <property name="small-blob.type" value="BLAH" dbms="all" /> makes the tests fail.

nodes.bodyText: Is it still need to keep old column in liquibase change? As far as I know we are using content_bytea only.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,86 @@
+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
+<databaseChangeLog xmlns="http://www.liquibase.org/xml/ns/dbchangelog"
+    xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
+    xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.liquibase.org/xml/ns/dbchangelog
+         http://www.liquibase.org/xml/ns/dbchangelog/dbchangelog-3.6.xsd">
+
+    <changeSet author="sap.com" id="create_table_lm_sl_persistence_file">
+        <preConditions onFail="MARK_RAN">
+            <not>
+                <tableExists tableName="lm_sl_persistence_file" />
+            </not>
+        </preConditions>
+        <createTable tableName="lm_sl_persistence_file">
+            <column name="file_id" type="CHAR(36)">
+                <constraints primaryKey="true" primaryKeyName="file_id_pk" nullable="false" />
+            </column>
+            <column name="content" type="${large-blob.type}" />
+            <column name="digest" type="VARCHAR(255)">
+                <constraints nullable="false" />
+            </column>
+            <column name="digest_algorithm" type="VARCHAR(255)">
+                <constraints nullable="false" />
+            </column>
+            <column name="modified" type="TIMESTAMP" />
+            <column name="file_name" type="VARCHAR(255)">
+                <constraints nullable="false" />
+            </column>
+            <column name="file_size" type="BIGINT">
+                <constraints nullable="false" />
+            </column>
+            <column name="namespace" type="VARCHAR(255)" />
+            <column name="space" type="VARCHAR(255)" />
+        </createTable>
+        <createIndex tableName="lm_sl_persistence_file" indexName="idx_lm_sl_persistence_file_space">
+            <column name="space" />
+        </createIndex>
+    </changeSet>
+
+    <changeSet author="sap.com" id="create_table_process_log">
+        <preConditions onFail="MARK_RAN">
+            <not>
+                <tableExists tableName="process_log" />
+            </not>
+        </preConditions>
+        <createTable tableName="process_log">
+            <column name="file_id" type="CHAR(36)">
+                <constraints primaryKey="true" primaryKeyName="log_file_id_pk" nullable="false" />
+            </column>
+            <column name="content" type="${large-blob.type}" />

nodes.bodyText: The goal of these changes is to refactor the structure of the changelogs and not the tables. The tables are left exactly as they were. If the content column is no longer needed it can be dropped in another change.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,86 @@
+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
+<databaseChangeLog xmlns="http://www.liquibase.org/xml/ns/dbchangelog"
+    xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
+    xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.liquibase.org/xml/ns/dbchangelog
+         http://www.liquibase.org/xml/ns/dbchangelog/dbchangelog-3.6.xsd">
+
+    <changeSet author="sap.com" id="create_table_lm_sl_persistence_file">
+        <preConditions onFail="MARK_RAN">
+            <not>
+                <tableExists tableName="lm_sl_persistence_file" />
+            </not>
+        </preConditions>
+        <createTable tableName="lm_sl_persistence_file">
+            <column name="file_id" type="CHAR(36)">
+                <constraints primaryKey="true" primaryKeyName="file_id_pk" nullable="false" />
+            </column>
+            <column name="content" type="${large-blob.type}" />
+            <column name="digest" type="VARCHAR(255)">
+                <constraints nullable="false" />
+            </column>
+            <column name="digest_algorithm" type="VARCHAR(255)">
+                <constraints nullable="false" />
+            </column>
+            <column name="modified" type="TIMESTAMP" />
+            <column name="file_name" type="VARCHAR(255)">
+                <constraints nullable="false" />
+            </column>
+            <column name="file_size" type="BIGINT">
+                <constraints nullable="false" />
+            </column>
+            <column name="namespace" type="VARCHAR(255)" />
+            <column name="space" type="VARCHAR(255)" />
+        </createTable>
+        <createIndex tableName="lm_sl_persistence_file" indexName="idx_lm_sl_persistence_file_space">
+            <column name="space" />
+        </createIndex>
+    </changeSet>
+
+    <changeSet author="sap.com" id="create_table_process_log">
+        <preConditions onFail="MARK_RAN">
+            <not>
+                <tableExists tableName="process_log" />
+            </not>
+        </preConditions>
+        <createTable tableName="process_log">
+            <column name="file_id" type="CHAR(36)">
+                <constraints primaryKey="true" primaryKeyName="log_file_id_pk" nullable="false" />
+            </column>
+            <column name="content" type="${large-blob.type}" />

nodes.bodyText:
Whatever it meant before in: 
  
    
      multiapps-controller/multiapps-controller-persistence/src/main/resources/org/cloudfoundry/multiapps/controller/persistence/db/changelog/db-changelog-add_trigger_for_lm_sl_persistance_file_process_log_cf.xml
    
    
         Line 14
      in
      43c220a
    
    
    
    

        
          
           lo_unlink(OLD.content); return NULL; END; ' LANGUAGE 'plpgsql' STABLE; 
        
    
  


There's no change here.

Previously we have added java classes which perform async index creation with CONCURRENTLY keyword which create index without locking the whole table. Does it mean now liquibase will use this feature of PostgreSQL to create indexes without locking whole tables?

nodes.bodyText: Nope. Indexes will now be created non-concurrently, but this is fine since these changesets will only be executed if the table/index/sequence doesn't already exist.

nodes.bodyText:
Why is the name on these foreign keys repeated?
Can't it be just FK_QRTZ_CRON_TRIGGERS?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -221,12 +236,25 @@
             <column name="END_TIME" type="BIGINT" />
             <column name="CALENDAR_NAME" type="NVARCHAR(200)" />
             <column name="MISFIRE_INSTR" type="SMALLINT" />
-            <column name="JOB_DATA" type="BLOB" />

         </createTable>
 
     </changeSet>

nodes.bodyText:
Now that this is gone, when will the changes be made?
Or do we even need to make these changes on app startup?
Since in both normal execution and in the event of an exception we return  NULL, wouldn't it be better if this is a procedure rather than a function?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,11 @@
+CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION UNLINK_FILE_CONTENT() RETURNS TRIGGER AS

nodes.bodyText:
I understand that this file is called in case of a rollback but wouldn't it be cleaner if these DROP statemets are executed immediately prior to the trigger's creation?
Or is it neccessary to have them deleted in a rollback?
